title: As a Malz and Azir main, can you guys like, f___ off for a few patches?
body:
give me a fking break with these nerfs.

i can just see it now :
patch 6.20 
-removed all damage and scaling for azirs q, w and e. R now lasts 0.2 seconds and no longer knocks up.
-malzahar passive now amplifies damage taken by 50% and stuns him for a short duration when popped.

seriously sucking all my passion out of this game each patch.
and before yall start on "azir is op he needs nerfs" if that was the case his winrate would be higher people OBVIOUSLY are dealing with it quite effectively.

/vent over

replies.body: It is probably because they only focus on pro players complaints. Azir and Malz aren't that good anymore and I wreck them in lane but Riot keeps nerfing because in the hands of a pro player they are broken in LCS.
honestly i know it sounds weird but, at this point id be ok with certain champs being nerfed for lcs and lcs only. as in they run a slightly different patch.

Im an Azir main, i have been since the day he came out (which is more than most others can say) 

and I'm glad for the nerfs, too many people play him now because Easyhoon or some other bastard did something cool in LCS and now every 12vie on the planet wants to be the emperor.

Azir used to be a damage utility mage, he used to have multiple knockups, shields, built in CDR, dashes, turrets, W damage on towers, his wall used to last a decent amount of time etc etc.

and slowly over time they have taken it all alway and just replaced it with sheer damage, and low and behold... its causing problems...

So my opinion is: **Nerf him into the ground!** so only the people who like Azir becasue of his play style (and not just cos he's strong or cos faker got a pentakill) will play him, and with no damage left, riot may choose to add some of his utility back (which was one of the things that made him fun) 

As for his win rate, Azir is a strong but hard champ (or used to be, before he became just pure damage and no utility), so the people who put the time in to main him have 70%+ win rates, everyone else sees that (and sees the pros play him) and they try to play him too thinking he is a free win, but feed horribly cos he is hard, and that decreases his win rate. having a low win rate doesnt mean he is not performing well.

Zed has a sub 50% win rate, yet people still ban him 40% of the time, cos everyone hates a Zed main. win rate isn't everything.

according to this site http://www.lolskill.net/top/highest-lolskillscore?filterChampion=268&filterRealm=
azirs winrate is about the same spread as every other top player at a certain champion
and all i mean is, people playing and getting really good at a champ generally do get a great winrate, but azirs arent any more than other champs so it not a thing specific to him/relevant.

and i totally agree i never play a champ because they are op, ive played malz for 3.5 years since i started playing league for the 1st time and picked up azir a while ago because i liked his character/lore and he looked fun.
yeah i did watch that earlier cheers for linking tho!
